isis.stitle: TSI 99-09-03 - Hood Modification to Prevent Interference and Scratching of the Right and Left Air Intake Scoop on 9200 Models Built Between September 1, 1998 to May 15, 1999

subjectgroup.subject: Hood Modification to Prevent Interference and Scratching of the Right and Left Air Intake Scoop on 9200 Models Built Between September 1, 1998 to May 15, 1999

geninfo.para: When opening the hood on random 9200 Models built between September 1, 1998 and May 15, 1999, the hood wing tip edge may occasionally scratch the right or left air intake scoop. To prevent this occurrence, a small amount of material may be removed from the hood wing tip.

note.para: To provide consistency of appearance, perform procedure on both sides of the hood.

step1.para: Open and support the vehicle hood in a working position and protect the engine compartment and painted surfaces from metal debris.
Mark a point 9/32 to 5/16 inch from the edge of the wing tip as shown in Figure 2.
Mark another point approximately 3 inches along the edge as shown in Figure 2.
Mark a line through the points ( Figure 2).
Mark a 5/8 inch radius to blend the line from Step 3 with the hood edge contour ( Figure 2).
Trim the hood edge. Sand or file to blend smooth the edges ( Figure 2).
Touch-up the edge with matching paint.
